newsitem.title: CUBA: C.E.Heath reported in Cuban joint venture.
newsitem.headline: C.E.Heath reported in Cuban joint venture.

text.p: Cuban state insurance company Esicuba and British insurance group C.E. Heath Plc have agreed to form a joint venture to provide insurance brokering in Cuba, Cuban media said Friday.
The venture will be Cuba's first foreign association in the insurance sector.
The official news agency Prensa Latina quoted the president of Esicuba, Ramon Martinez, as announcing the agreement at the end of an insurance conference in Havana this week.
The news agency gave no details of the structure of the proposed new company. Officials from the Cuban and British companies were not available for comment.

Esicuba (Seguros Internacionales de Cuba S.A.) offers insurance coverage to Cuban and foreign interests in Cuba and to Cuban interests abroad. It also operates in the international reinsurance market.
Its venture with a foreign company is in line with Cuba's current policy of seeking foreign investment in virtually all sectors of the economy.
